register.description: Provides implementation-specific minor revision information

bitfield.description: The contents of this field are IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED

register.description: Provides identification information for the PE, including an implementer code for the device and a device ID number

bitfield.description: This field must hold an implementer code that has been assigned by ARM
IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED variant number. Typically, this field is used to distinguish between different product variants, or major revisions of a product
Defines the Architecture implemented by the PE
IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED primary part number for the device
IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED revision number for the device

register.description: Controls and provides status information for NMI, PendSV, SysTick and interrupts

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the NMI exception is pending
Allows the NMI exception pend state to be cleared
Reserved, RES0
Indicates whether the PendSV `FTSSS exception is pending
Allows the PendSV exception pend state to be cleared `FTSSS
Indicates whether the SysTick `FTSSS exception is pending
Allows the SysTick exception pend state to be cleared `FTSSS
Controls whether in a single SysTick implementation, the SysTick is Secure or Non-secure
Indicates whether a pending exception will be serviced on exit from debug halt state
Indicates whether an external interrupt, generated by the NVIC, is pending
Reserved, RES0
The exception number of the highest priority pending and enabled interrupt
In Handler mode, indicates whether there is more than one active exception
Reserved, RES0
The exception number of the current executing exception

register.description: Indicates the offset of the vector table base address from memory address 0x00000000

bitfield.description: Bits 31 down to 7 of the vector table base offset.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: This register is used to determine data endianness, clear all active state information for debug or to recover from a hard failure, execute a system reset, alter the priority grouping position (binary point).

bitfield.description: Register key. Writing to this register (AIRCR) requires 0x05FA in VECTKEY. Otherwise the write value is ignored. Read always returns 0xFA05.
Data endianness bit 0 Little-endian. 1 Big-endian.
Prioritize Secure exceptions. The value of this bit defines whether Secure exception priority boosting is enabled.

BusFault, HardFault, and NMI Non-secure enable. The value of this bit defines whether BusFault and NMI exceptions are Non-secure, and whether exceptions target the Non-secure HardFault exception 0x0 BusFault, HardFault, and NMI are Secure. 0x1 BusFault and NMI are Non-secure and exceptions can target Non-secure HardFault.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Interrupt priority grouping field. This field determines the split of group priority from subpriority
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
System reset request Secure only. The value of this bit defines whether the SYSRESETREQ bit is functional for Non-secure use
System reset request. This bit allows software or a debugger to request a system reset: 0 Do not request a system reset. 1 Request a system reset. This bit is not banked between Security states.
Reserved for Debug use. This bit reads as 0. When writing to the register you must write 0 to this bit, otherwise behavior is UNPREDICTABLE.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: This register is used for power-management functions, i.e., signaling to the system when the processor can enter a low power state, controlling how the processor enters and exits low power states.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

Send Event on Pending bit: 0 Only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded. 1 Enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor. When an event or interrupt enters pending state, the event signal wakes up the processor from WFE. If the processor is not waiting for an event, the event is registered and affects the next WFE. The processor also wakes up on execution of an SEV instruction or an external event. This bit is banked between Security states.

Controls whether the SLEEPDEEP bit is only accessible from the Secure state: 0 The SLEEPDEEP bit accessible from both Security states. 1 The SLEEPDEEP bit behaves as RAZ/WI when accessed from the Non-secure state. This bit in only accessible from the Secure state, and behaves as RAZ/WI when accessed from the Nonsecure state. This bit is not banked between Security states.
Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode. 0 Sleep. 1 Deep sleep. This bit is not banked between Security states.

Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode: 0 Do not sleep when returning to Thread mode. 1 Enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR. Setting this bit to 1 enables an interrupt driven application to avoid returning to an empty main application. This bit is banked between Security states.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

register.description: Sets or returns configuration and control data

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Enables program flow prediction `FTSSS
This is a global enable bit for instruction caches in the selected Security state
Enables data caching of all data accesses to Normal memory `FTSSS
Reserved, RES0
Controls the effect of a stack limit violation while executing at a requested priority less than 0
Reserved, RES1
Determines the effect of precise BusFaults on handlers running at a requested priority less than 0
Reserved, RES0
Controls the generation of a DIVBYZERO UsageFault when attempting to perform integer division by zero
Controls the trapping of unaligned word or halfword accesses
Reserved, RES0
Determines whether unprivileged accesses are permitted to pend interrupts via the STIR
Reserved, RES1

register.description: Sets or returns priority for system handlers 4 - 7

bitfield.description: Priority of system handler 7, SecureFault
Priority of system handler 6, UsageFault
Priority of system handler 5, BusFault
Priority of system handler 4, MemManage

register.description: Sets or returns priority for system handlers 8 - 11

bitfield.description: Priority of system handler 11, SVCall
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Sets or returns priority for system handlers 12 - 15

bitfield.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick
Priority of system handler 14, PendSV
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides access to the active and pending status of system exceptions

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
`IAAMO the pending state of the HardFault exception `CTTSSS
`IAAMO the pending state of the SecureFault exception
`DW the SecureFault exception is enabled
`DW the UsageFault exception is enabled `FTSSS
`DW the BusFault exception is enabled
`DW the MemManage exception is enabled `FTSSS
`IAAMO the pending state of the SVCall exception `FTSSS
`IAAMO the pending state of the BusFault exception
`IAAMO the pending state of the MemManage exception `FTSSS
The UsageFault exception is banked between Security states, `IAAMO the pending state of the UsageFault exception `FTSSS
`IAAMO the active state of the SysTick exception `FTSSS
`IAAMO the active state of the PendSV exception `FTSSS
Reserved, RES0
`IAAMO the active state of the DebugMonitor exception
`IAAMO the active state of the SVCall exception `FTSSS
Reserved, RES0
`IAAMO the active state of the NMI exception
`IAAMO the active state of the SecureFault exception
`IAAMO the active state of the UsageFault exception `FTSSS
Indicates and allows limited modification of the active state of the HardFault exception `FTSSS
`IAAMO the active state of the BusFault exception
`IAAMO the active state of the MemManage exception `FTSSS

register.description: Contains the three Configurable Fault Status Registers

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Sticky flag indicating whether an integer division by zero error has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether an unaligned access error has occurred
Reserved, RES0
Sticky flag indicating whether a stack overflow error has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether a coprocessor disabled or not present error has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether an integrity check error has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether an EPSR.T or EPSR.IT validity error has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether an undefined instruction error has occurred
Indicates validity of the contents of the BFAR register
Reserved, RES0
Records whether a BusFault occurred during FP lazy state preservation
Records whether a derived BusFault occurred during exception entry stacking
Records whether a derived BusFault occurred during exception return unstacking
Records whether an imprecise data access error has occurred
Records whether a precise data access error has occurred
Records whether a BusFault on an instruction prefetch has occurred
Indicates validity of the MMFAR register
Reserved, RES0
Records whether a MemManage fault occurred during FP lazy state preservation
Records whether a derived MemManage fault occurred during exception entry stacking
Records whether a derived MemManage fault occurred during exception return unstacking
Reserved, RES0
Records whether a data access violation has occurred
Records whether an instruction related memory access violation has occurred

register.description: Shows the cause of any HardFaults

bitfield.description: Indicates when a Debug event has occurred
Indicates that a fault with configurable priority has been escalated to a HardFault exception, because it could not be made active, because of priority, or because it was disabled
Reserved, RES0
Indicates when a fault has occurred because of a vector table read error on exception processing
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Shows which debug event occurred

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Sticky flag indicating whether an External debug request debug event has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether a Vector catch debug event has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether a Watchpoint debug event has occurred
Sticky flag indicating whether a Breakpoint debug event has occurred
Sticky flag indicating that a Halt request debug event or Step debug event has occurred

register.description: Shows the address of the memory location that caused an MPU fault

bitfield.description: This register is updated with the address of a location that produced a MemManage fault. The MMFSR shows the cause of the fault, and whether this field is valid. This field is valid only when MMFSR.MMARVALID is set, otherwise it is UNKNOWN

register.description: Shows the address associated with a precise data access BusFault

bitfield.description: This register is updated with the address of a location that produced a BusFault. The BFSR shows the reason for the fault. This field is valid only when BFSR.BFARVALID is set, otherwise it is UNKNOWN

register.description: This register is used to determine additional system fault information to software. Single-cycle high level on an auxiliary faults is latched as one. The bit can only be cleared by writing a one to the corresponding bit. Auxiliary fault inputs to the CPU are tied to 0.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Implementation defined. The bits map directly onto the signal assignment to the auxiliary fault inputs. Tied to 0

T32 instruction set support
A32 instruction set support

register.description: Gives information about the programmers' model and Extensions support

Identifies support for the M-Profile programmers' model support
Identifies whether the Security Extension is implemented
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides top level information about the debug system

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0

Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides information about the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED features of the PE

IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED meaning

IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED meaning

Indicates support for Auxiliary Control Registers
Indicates support for tightly coupled memories (TCMs)
Indicates the number of shareability levels implemented
Indicates the outermost shareability domain implemented
Indicates support for the protected memory system architecture (PMSA)
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Indicates the support for Wait For Interrupt (WFI) stalling
Reserved, RES0

register.description: Provides information about the implemented memory model and memory management support

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Indicates the supported branch predictor maintenance
Indicates the supported cache maintenance operations by set/way
Indicates the supported cache maintenance operations by address

register.description: Provides information about the instruction set implemented by the PE

Indicates the supported Divide instructions
Indicates the implemented Debug instructions
Indicates the supported Coprocessor instructions
Indicates the supported combined Compare and Branch instructions
Indicates the supported bit field instructions
Indicates the supported bit count instructions

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Indicates the implemented Interworking instructions
Indicates the implemented for data-processing instructions with long immediates
Indicates the implemented If-Then instructions

bitfield.description: Indicates the implemented Reversal instructions

Indicates the implemented advanced unsigned Multiply instructions
Indicates the implemented advanced signed Multiply instructions
Indicates the implemented additional Multiply instructions
Indicates the support for interruptible multi-access instructions

Indicates the implemented true NOP instructions

Indicates the implemented Barrier instructions

Indicates the support for writeback addressing modes

register.description: Provides information about the instruction set implemented by the PE

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0

register.description: Identifies the type of caches implemented and the level of coherency and unification

bitfield.description: This field indicates the boundary between inner and outer domain

bitenum.token: L3 cache is the highest inner level
bitenum.description: L3 cache is the highest inner level

bitenum.token: L2 cache is the highest inner level
bitenum.description: L2 cache is the highest inner level

bitenum.token: L1 cache is the highest inner level
bitenum.description: L1 cache is the highest inner level

bitfield.description: This field indicates the Level of Unification Uniprocessor for the cache hierarchy
This field indicates the Level of Coherence for the cache hierarchy
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP0
Cache type field 7. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 7.
Cache type field 6. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 6.
Cache type field 5. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 5.
Cache type field 4. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 4.
Cache type field 3. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 3.
Cache type field 2. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 2.
Cache type field 1. Indicates the type of cache implemented at level 1.

register.description: The CTR provides information about the architecture of the currently selected cache

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES1
Reserved, RES0
Log2 of the number of words of the maximum size of memory that can be overwritten as a result of the eviction of a cache entry that has had a memory location in it modified
Log2 of the number of words of the maximum size of the reservation granule that has been implemented for the Load-Exclusive and Store-Exclusive instructions
Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the data caches and unified caches that are controlled by the PE
Reserved, RES1
Reserved, RES0
Log2 of the number of words in the smallest cache line of all the instruction caches that are controlled by the PE

register.description: Provides information about the architecture of the caches. CCSIDR is RES0 if CLIDR is zero.

bitfield.description: Indicates whether the currently selected cache level supports Write-Through
Indicates whether the currently selected cache level supports Write-Back
Indicates whether the currently selected cache level supports read-allocation
Indicates whether the currently selected cache level supports write-allocation
Indicates (Number of sets in the currently selected cache) - 1. Therefore, a value of 0 indicates that 1 is set in the cache. The number of sets does not have to be a power of 2
Indicates (Associativity of cache) - 1. A value of 0 indicates an associativity of 1. The associativity does not have to be a power of 2
Indicates (Log2(Number of words per line in the currently selected cache)) - 2.

register.description: Selects the current Cache Size ID Register, CCSIDR, by specifying the required cache level and the cache type (either instruction or data cache)

bitfield.description: Selects which cache level is to be identified. Permitted values are from 0b000, indicating Level 1 cache, to 0b110 indicating Level 7 cache
Selects whether the instruction or the data cache is to be identified

register.description: Specifies the access privileges for coprocessors and the FP Extension

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0

The value in this field is ignored. If the implementation does not include the FP Extension, this field is RAZ/WI. If the value of this bit is not programmed to the same value as the CP10 field, then the value is UNKNOWN
Defines the access rights for the floating-point functionality
Reserved, RES0
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 7
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 6
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 5
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 4
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 3
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 2
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 1
Controls access privileges for coprocessor 0

register.description: Defines the Non-secure access permissions for both the FP Extension and coprocessors CP0 to CP7

bitfield.description: Reserved, RES0
Enables Non-secure access to the Floating-point Extension
Enables Non-secure access to the Floating-point Extension
Reserved, RES0
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP7
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP6
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP5
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP4
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP3
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP2
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP1
Enables Non-secure access to coprocessor CP0
